item.title: Report X-2025020737
item.description:
Report X-2025020737

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-25T00:50:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-05
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=771647933665 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid-paste TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Loading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1173 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=Ethyl Acetate PKG GRP=II SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=0.008 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Liter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=B - Glass# porcelain# or stoneware NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=1 INNER PKG TYPE=1 - Bottle TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=0.008 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter )Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=771647933665 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid-paste TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Loading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1206 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=Heptanes PKG GRP=II SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=0.25 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Liter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=B - Glass# porcelain# or stoneware NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=1 INNER PKG TYPE=1 - Bottle TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=0.25 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter )A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH location. Inside of the fiberboard box was a plastic case containing the commodities two glass bottles and a small metal can. The lid of the can came off spilling all of the contents. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2025020232
item.description:
Report E-2025020232

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-19T06:18:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-15
  • City: JACKSON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 116000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 15, 2025, at 1602 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Inway personnel in Jackson, TN regarding the release of several hazardous materials. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 48 pounds of UN3106 Organic Peroxide type D, 5.2, II from (5) 10-lbs plastic pails, 12 gallons of UN1866 Resin solution, 3, II from (2) 6-gallon metal pails, 80 gallons of UN1760 Corrosive liquids, 8, III from (16) 5-gallon metal pails, and 90 gallons of non-regulated Tremco Epoxy Primer Part A from (18) 5-gallon metal pails onto the ground. The release was reportedly due to a rollover accident during transit, impacting multiple areas of soil and asphalt. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned up with the proper PPE. Contractors removed the damaged product and repalletized the good product. All waste generated from addressing this release was placed into roll-off containers, which were taken off site by the contractor for proper disposal.
